Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Afoot \A*foot"\, adv. [Pref. a- + foot.] 1. On foot. [1913 Webster]
We 'll walk afoot a while. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
2. Fig.: In motion; in action; astir; in progress. [1913 Webster]
The matter being afoot. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

afoot adj 1: traveling by foot; "she was afoot when I saw her this morning" [syn: {afoot(p)}] 2: currently in progress; "there is mischief afoot"; "plans are afoot"; "preparations for the trial are underway" [syn: {afoot(p)}, {underway}] adv : on foot; walking; "they went to the village afoot"; "quail are hunted either afoot or on horseback"
